page.title: 13STRAWBERRY PICKING
page.content: At 4.30 the alarm screams and I drag myself out of bed. By 6.00 I am at the field with a row of my own berries stretching before me; awake at last. The weather is very warm, sun shining in a beautiful clear sky and the fresh country air scented with strawberries. Picking is a lot of fun, though frustrating when the stalks break off. I like the peaceful quiet with everyone busily picking and thinking private thoughts. The others are friendly and always good for a laugh. When I'm in a picking mood I fill more boxes but some days my back aches, I feel hot and my hands move slowly. That's when I reach out and collect a handful of squashed strawberry - erk! Mostly I find time flies when I'm picking; out in the field, busy picking strawberries and getting a sun tan - and 80 pence a box.
